etymologies: mid 19th century: from preference, on the pattern of differential

definitions: of or involving preference or partiality; constituting a favor or privilege

examples.text: preferential interest rates may be offered to employees

definitions: (of a union shop) giving employment preference to union members
shortDefinitions: giving employment preference to union members

definitions: (of voting or an election) in which the voter puts candidates in order of preference.
shortDefinitions: (of voting or election) in which voter puts candidates in order of preference

definitions: (of a creditor) having a claim on the receipt of payment from a debtor which will be met before those of other creditors.
shortDefinitions: (of creditor) having claim on receipt of payment from debtor
